reg:regulation.reg:title: Community Airport Exemption Regulation
reg:regulation.reg:amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 228/2018, October 29, 2018]

bcl:section.bcl:text: The following community airports are prescribed for the purposes of section 223 (1) (b) of the Community Charter:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: Boundary Bay Airport in relation to the lands described in section 1 of the Schedule;
Comox Valley Airport in relation to the lands described in section 2 of the Schedule;
Fort St. John Airport in relation to the lands described in section 3 of the Schedule;
Kamloops Airport in relation to the lands described in section 4 of the Schedule;
Nanaimo Airport in relation to the lands described in section 5 of the Schedule;
Pitt Meadows Airport in relation to the lands described in section 6 of the Schedule;
Prince Rupert Airport in relation to the lands described in section 7 of the Schedule;
Smithers Regional Airport in relation to the lands described in section 8 of the Schedule;
Terrace-Kitimat Airport in relation to the lands described in section 9 of the Schedule;
Victoria Airport in relation to the lands described in section 10 of the Schedule;
Williams Lake Airport in relation to the lands described in section 11 of the Schedule;
Prince George Airport in relation to the lands described in section 12 of the Schedule.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The following improvements on the community airports prescribed under section 1 are exempted from property tax levies under any Act:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: paved runways, paved taxiways and paved common-use aprons for fixed-wing aircraft;
sidewalks and other paving not otherwise included under paragraph (a) that are used for community airport purposes;
airport navigation aids, including runway lights and unenclosed communication towers;

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: As an exception, an exemption under subsection (1) does not apply to improvements held or occupied by a person other than the operator of the community airport.

For greater certainty, a structure or work that is a building designed primarily for the shelter of people, living things, plant or personal property is not an improvement to which an exemption under subsection (1) may apply.
